Motor¶

class Motor¶

The Motor class is a sub class of the port class which allows to control PoweredUP Motors. It can be used via sensor=hub.port.A.motor.

default(max_power=0, speed=0, stall=True, acceleration=100, deceleration=150, stop=1, callback=None)¶

Set default parameters of the motor

Parameters

  • pid (tuple) – PID controller gains

  • max_power (integer) – maximum power that can be used by motor

  • speed (integer) – default speed

  • stall (boolean) – set stall detection on or off

  • acceleration (int) – the duration time for an acceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an acceleration time of 300 ms from 40% to 70%

  • deceleration (int) – the duration time for a deceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an deceleration time of 300 ms from 70% to 40%

  • stop (int) – action performed after the given time: float = 0, brake = 1, hold = 2

  • callback (bound method) – set callback that is called at (?)

Returns

list of current default motor settings

Return type

dict

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.default(max_power = 50, stop = 2) #set max power to 50 and stop action to hold
print("default settings: " + str(MotorA.default()))
mode(mode)¶

Set the mode of the motor, this mainly affects the measurement output

Parameters

mode (int) – new mode

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.mode(3)              # Set motor mode to absolute position
MotorA.mode([3,2])          # Set motor mode to absolute position and relative position

print("Mode motor port A: " + str(MotorA.mode()))
preset(angle)¶

Preset the value of the relative position

Parameters

angle (int) – preset position: best practice is to use current position, or absolute position

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

# Set mode to absolute position
MotorA.mode(3)
curr_abs_pos, = MotorA.get()

MotorA.preset(curr_abs_pos)
pid(p, i, d)¶

Set controller gains of the PID controller

Warning

The applied values of the actual controller do not seem to change.

Parameters

  • p (int) – proportional gain

  • i (int) – integral gain

  • d (int) – derivative gain

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.pid(100,100,100)
get()¶

Get measurement of the motor corresponding to the active mode

Returns

measurement

Return type

tuple

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.mode(3)          # Absolute position mode
abs_pos = MotorA.get()[0]
print("Absolute position: " + str(abs_pos))

Motor.mode([(1, 0), (2, 2)])  #Speed in RAW units and relative position in SI units
measurements = MotorA.get()
print("Speed : " + str(measurements[0]) + " Relative position: " + str(measurements[1]))
busy(busy_type)¶

Check if motor is busy with performing an action

Parameters

busy_type (int) – type of action: 0 (? yet unknown action); 1 reaching a target
pwm(power)¶

Set motor power

Parameters

power (int) – in range [-100,…, 100]

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.pwm(40)    # start motor
sleep_ms(1000)    # wait 1 second
MotorA.pwm(0)     # stop motor
run_at_speed(speed, max_power=100, acceleration=100, deceleration=100)¶

Start motor at given speed

Parameters

  • speed (int) – a percentage off the maximum speed of the motor in the range [-100,…, 100]

  • max_power (int) – maximum power that can be used by the motor

  • acceleration (int) – the duration time for an acceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an acceleration time of 300 ms from 40% to 70%

  • deceleration (int) – the duration time for a deceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an deceleration time of 300 ms from 70% to 40%

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.run_at_speed(speed=50)   # turn motor at speed 50
sleep_ms(1000)                  # wait 1000 millisecond
MotorA.run_at_speed(0)          # turn motor at speed 0, i.e., stop
run_for_time(time, speed=50, max_power=100, acceleration=100, deceleration=100, stop_action=0)¶

Rotate motor for a given time

Parameters

  • time – time in milliseconds

  • speed (int) – a percentage off the maximum speed of the motor in the range [-100,…, 100]

  • max_power (int) – maximum power that can be used by the motor

  • acceleration (int) – the duration time for an acceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an acceleration time of 300 ms from 40% to 70%

  • deceleration (int) – the duration time for a deceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an deceleration time of 300 ms from 70% to 40%

  • stop_action (int) – action performed after the given time: float = 0, brake = 1, hold = 2

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.run_for_time(1000,speed=50)   # turn motor for 1000 milliseconds at speed 50
run_for_degrees(degrees, speed=50, max_power=100, acceleration=100, deceleration=100, stop_action=0)¶

Rotate motor for a given number of degrees relative to current position

Parameters

  • degrees – relative degrees

  • speed (int) – a percentage off the maximum speed of the motor in the range [-100,…, 100]

  • max_power (int) – maximum power that can be used by the motor

  • acceleration (int) – the duration time for an acceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an acceleration time of 300 ms from 40% to 70%

  • deceleration (int) – the duration time for a deceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an deceleration time of 300 ms from 70% to 40%

  • stop_action (int) – action performed after the given time: float = 0, brake = 1, hold = 2

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor
MotorB = port.B.motor

# Turn motors to different positions in parallel
MotorA.run_for_degrees(100,speed=50)
MotorB.run_for_degrees(-400,speed=50)
run_to_position(degrees, speed=50, max_power=100, acceleration=100, deceleration=100, stop_action=0)¶

Rotate motor for a given number of degrees relative to current position

Parameters

  • degrees – relative degrees

  • speed (int) – a percentage off the maximum speed of the motor in the range [-100,…, 100]

  • max_power (int) – maximum power that can be used by the motor

  • acceleration (int) – the duration time for an acceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an acceleration time of 300 ms from 40% to 70%

  • deceleration (int) – the duration time for a deceleration from 0 to 100%. i.e. a time set to 1000 ms. should give an deceleration time of 300 ms from 70% to 40%

  • stop_action (int) – action performed after the given time: float = 0, brake = 1, hold = 2

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.mode(2)# set mode to absolute position

MotorA.preset(MotorA.get()[0])# preset 0 position to absolute zero position

# Turn motors to different positions in parallel
MotorA.run_to_position(180,speed=50)
float()¶

Float motor from current position

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.pwm(40)      # start motor
sleep_ms(1000)      # wait 1 second
MotorA.float()      # float motor
brake()¶

Brake motor at current position

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.pwm(40)      # start motor
sleep_ms(1000)      # wait 1 second
MotorA.brake()      # apply brake
hold()¶

Actively hold motor at current position

from hub import port
from utime import sleep_ms

MotorA = port.A.motor

MotorA.pwm(40)     # start motor
sleep_ms(1000)     # wait 1 second
MotorA.hold()      # actively hold position
sleep_ms(10000)    # wait 10 second active resistance should be noticable
MotorA.float()     # float motor
pair(motor)¶

Pair two motors. Both motors can now be controlled as a pair (even with different speeds).

Parameters

motor (Motor) – motor to pair current motor with

from hub import port

MotorA = port.A.motor
MotorB = port.B.motor

Pair=MotorA.pair(MotorB)

Pair.run_for_degrees(270, 100, 50) # Motor A turns 360 and Motor B turns 180
                                   # Combined distance = 2*270
